question: The range of electrical conductivity (<katex>$\sigma$</katex>) and resistivity (<katex>$\rho$</katex>) for metals, among the following, is
explanation: Metals are good conductors, so they have low resistivity (<katex>$\rho \approx 10^{-2}$</katex> to <katex>$10^{-8} \Omega m$</katex>) and high conductivity (<katex>$\sigma \approx 10^2$</katex> to <katex>$10^8 S/m$</katex>).
